docs.text: What is SSTD ? SubStandardLibrary (SSTD) is a convenient functions set for C++, works on GCC(g++). Installation Downloading source code from github.com/admiswalker/SubStandardLibrary . Copying all of under ./sstd/*. Compilling the sstd. $ cd ./sstd $ make Adding flags in your makefile. CFLAGS += -I./sstd/include -L./sstd/lib -lsstd CFLAGS += -std=gnu++0x Including a header #include <sstd/sstd.hpp> in your code. License MIT licence or Public domain. (This software is dual license, so you can choose whichever you want). Repository github.com/admiswalker/SubStandardLibrary
docs.title: What is SSTD ?
